name: Hotel Arvor

reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay at the Hotel Arvor
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 10 days at the Hotel Arvor last summer. The rooms were large, clean, and the staff very efficient. The hotel is located next to a plaza and in the middle of many nice shops and resturants.

reviews.title: friendly arvor
reviews.text: But most of all, we enjoyed the people. M. Renault and his wife were very nice and helpful. We felt we were treated like family and they made it hard for us to leave.

reviews.title: Arvor revisited.
reviews.text: However, we will be returning soon and look forward to seeing them again.

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: Clean and Bright. Extremely friendly and helpful owner/manager. Whole family enjoyed it.

We stayed at the Arvor this July having booked four rooms for one night for our party of 6 which included elderly/disabled. Our rooms were lovely and easily accessible for aged parents and they had reserved a parking space for us right by reception entrance.
reviews.title: Super Hotel;great location!

likes.liked: — It's location; secure off road parking
likes.disliked: — they speak good English,so don't be afraid to book by phone

reviews.text: The hotel is ideally located in the centre of Dinan and within a couple of hundred yards of some excellent restaurants. Le Petit Train which gives you an excellent value 3/4 hour tour of Dinan stop is right outside!
reviews.title: Taste of France
viola! feels so like home
reviews.text: We will certainly go back and can thoroughly recommend the Arvor if you want a comfortable and good value base in this beautiful old town.

reviews.title: Home away from home
reviews.text: Smallish room but clean hotel located in centre of a beautiful little town full of stone and timber buildings with a medieval theme well worth the visit. Very friendly and helpful staff with the owner conversant in English and had even been to Australia in his navy days. Nice breakfast in a bright dining room off street parking.

reviews.title: My June visit
reviews.text: Madame and Messieur Renault made us feel so so at home in their well-run hotel from the moment we stepped in till we drove off. The Eur 51.50 room was extremely spacious and clean, the bakery at breakfast was really fresh. We were greeted with warm smiles at all times, and even though they were always busy, they never failed to pause for a chat, give directions or recommendations and guide us out of their parking area. We'll never forget you, thank you so much and we hope to see you again!!

description: Situated in the heart of the Mediaeval city of Dinan, opposite the " Théatre des Jacobins" The hotel welcomes you on this exceptional site, steeped with history. The 18th century rennaissance style building was built on the site of a Jocobin convent. In this hotel of charm, like the family home you will be seduced by a warm and charming atmosphere. 24 rooms and suites offering a magnificant view over this historic center and the celebrated "clock tower", a symbol of the town.
